conclusion: The temperature at state A is \( T_A = -73^\circ\text{C} = 200\,\text{K} \). The pressure at state A is \( p_A = 3 \times 10^5\,\text{Pa} \) and the volume is \( V_A = 1 \times 10^{-3}\,\text{m}^3 \).

premise: Using the ideal gas law: \( pV = nRT \) for state A.

conclusion: The process \( A \to B \) is an isobaric expansion.

premise: The work done in an isobaric process \( W_{AB} = p_A (V_B - V_A) \).

conclusion: The process \( B \to C \) is an isochoric process.

premise: No work is done in an isochoric process.
Total work done \( W_{AC} = W_{AB} + W_{BC} \).

conclusion: The change in internal energy for the process \( A \to C \) is given as \( \Delta U = 200\,\text{J} \).

premise: Using the first law of thermodynamics: \( \Delta U = Q - W \).

conclusion: The volume at state C is \( V_C = 4 \times 10^{-3}\,\text{m}^3 \) and the pressure is \( p_C = 1 \times 10^5\,\text{Pa} \).

premise: Using the ideal gas law for state C: \( p_C V_C = n R T_C \).
